meanings.definition: To break into many pieces suddenly
meanings.sent1: The glass vase will shatter if it falls.
meanings.sent2: The mirror may shatter if you drop it.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally made the plate shatter into tiny bits.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it would shatter into a million pieces.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise made the window shatter loudly.

meanings.definition: To damage or destroy something completely
meanings.sent1: The storm could shatter the fragile roof of the shed.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake might shatter the old building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to shatter the vase.
meanings.sent4: The news seemed to shatter his hopes and dreams.
meanings.sent5: The explosion could shatter the entire mountain into pieces.

meanings.definition: To cause great emotional pain or distress
meanings.sent1: The loss of her pet would shatter her heart.
meanings.sent2: The rejection letter could shatter his confidence.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news seemed to shatter her happiness.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words seemed to shatter their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The tragic ending of the movie would shatter the audience's emotions.
